intro: Prockia flava, commonly known as the yellow prockia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Prockia flava is native to temperate regions of Europe and is valued for its ornamental appeal and medicinal properties.
